tn.ref: Is this not a brand pulled from the fire?
tn.text: AT: "Joshua is like a stick pulled from a fire" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: a brand pulled from the fire
tn.text: A brand is a piece of burning wood that is removed from a fire before it is completely burned up. This refers to Joshua, who was rescued from captivity in Babylon and returned to Jerusalem. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
In this vision dirty clothes are being used as a symbol to show sinfulness.
a piece of long cloth wrapped around the head
"commanded Joshua in a very serious manner"
Walking in the same ways refers to doing the same things. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: if you will keep my commandments
tn.text: AT: "if you will remember and obey my commandments" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
The angel of Yahweh continues to speak to Joshua.

tn.ref: your companions who live with you
tn.text: AT: "the other priest who live with you"

The title "Branch" should be translated in the same way as the branch of a tree. It means the servant of Yahweh will come from Yahweh like a branch comes from a tree. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
words that are written on something or cut into something

tn.ref: this is the declaration of Yahweh of hosts
tn.text: This phrase is often translated as "Yahweh says" in the UDB. You can translate this concept whichever way is best in your language. This phrase is used many times in Zechariah.

tn.ref: this is the declaration of Yahweh of hosts
tn.text: This phrase is often translated as "Yahweh says" in the UDB. You can translate this concept whichever way is best in your language. This phrase is used many times in Zechariah.
